column11: Review Text
Definitely worth the visit. Magnificent scenery and a fun jeep ride. A lovely experience. Inexpensive and good local drivers

Moon Plains is just 4 km from Nuwara Eliya Town and 3 km from Gregory Park, The best time to visit is early morning to enjoy the sunrise and the stunning 360¬∞ mountain view. Entrance is LKR 100 for adults and LKR 50 for children. A safari jeep is required to reach the viewpoint and costs LKR 3,000 for a 30-minute ride -totally worth it. Private cars, vans, and buses are not allowed. Motorbikes are permitted but not recommended because the road is currently damaged and slippery due to rain.

column8: Breathtaking Views at Moon Plains ‚Äì A Must-Visit in Nuwara Eliya!
column11: I visited The Moon Plains in Nuwara Eliya and it was an unforgettable experience. The view from the top is absolutely stunning‚Äîyou can see mountains all around, and the fresh air feels amazing. It‚Äôs a peaceful and quiet place, perfect for nature lovers. The drive up was beautiful too. I took many photos and enjoyed every moment. If you visit Nuwara Eliya, don‚Äôt miss this hidden gem!

column8: For the attention of Moon Place authorities
column11: Due to the undisciplined drivers, the tourists face many difficulties. This person named Kumara bearing the number PT-9315 takes more money as a bribe than the jeep fare.And when we went there, he also tried to drive drunk, he covered his face with a piece of cloth to prevent the stench from coming out.

column8: Visit to moon plains hills on a jeeb car ride
column11: Very beutiful land scape reminds me with Salalah-Oman during khareef season.  This place i visited today has a jeeb car ride it took us to highest spot , a perfect place for taking photoes. Our driver Doome made our trip safe and enjoyable
It's beautiful place n cool. The environment is really enjoyble. Tour driver were excellent and safely drove the vehicle
Not bad and very nice view. Accessible with children. Admission costs Rs 600 per adult and Rs 5,000 for the one-hour jeep ride for up to 6 people.
The staff here is very arrogant and they keep the locals waiting and give priority for foreigners.. simply they get paid a little higher

column8: Avoid at all costs - Tourist rip-off
column11: The place is a rip-off.  They only allow you on the grounds if you purchase the Jeep tour from them which is an exorbitant 6000 lkr - a price that seems to increase monthly (see previous reviews) There is a separate entrance fee which would suggest that walking the grounds was originally an option. The company managing the property is awful. They are using Moon Plains to fleece unsuspecting tourists.  Avoid at all costs!!

Lovely place to visit early morning. We got there by car at 7am and got a jeep. The driver was Jayantha who was eager to show and explain the area. There is a vegetable Agro Garden if kids want to learn more. We were done in 60min and came back to the hotel for breakfast
Beautiful place at the top of a mountain. An observation point. Its a beautiful view of the blue sky and the green mountains, also can see other mountain peaks.

Breathtaking views of central mountain range and the welimada plains. Safari jeep price was reasonable at 3000LKR. My main negative is they charge additional 80LKR just as an entry ticket (more from foriegners) but  toilets are aweful and dirty. No other facilities at all.
Beautiful place in Nuwera Eliya.  Not very far from the center and the race course. Once you get there scenery is breathtaking

Worst safari service I ever seen. First at all, there is no need of safari jeep service, any good vehicle would do the job. It's only a way created for making a living for some / few people. They charge entrance fees and again for safari jeep. Jeep can accommodate 6 personal. You can team up with other tourists at the site and share the fee but, those greedy safari guides and drivers are not encouraging it, also tried to get a chunk of money from us for no reason. If you are not visiting as a group of 6, try to group up at the site. Alsonif you are a foreigner, you may pay quite a large amount more than local travellers, so don't waste a tip for those safari riders or guides. They are not allowing foreigners to team up with locals because they are always hoping to get money from you as tips or pretending to be guiding or any other means. Who may authorized to put up a safari business and then restricted the access to this place should do a better better job by following up and reviewing who are and what kind of people they entrusted to do they job

A hidden attraction that does not normally surface when searching.. Luckily we found by asking chetGPT for unusual attraction and it came up with it., Beautiful scearu across the plains in a safari jeep( reasonably priced), to a pountsin top view point, almost in the clouds and cliff with steep drop, great for photos.. Jeep ride can be very bumpy so if you are senditive take note

Amazing views, a little bit like a ‚ÄúMini worlds end‚Äù. Unfortunately you cannot walk around there much, you always have to get a safari jeep, but that is also a nice experience. I took many pictures!

This is such a beautiful place with wind and nature and the safari ride was a great experience and ride cost Rs 3,000 . it takes only nearly one hour for the journey.it s better if you could go there early in the morning and after climbing on the top 360 degree view is breathtaking. Agro park is best if you wanna buy fresh vegetables and strawberries.
You should visit this place, amazing view, all the mountains view is there. Our jeep dirver is very good he explained everything, thank you.
This is a must go place if you visit Nuwaraeliya. Safari was amazing and once you reach the pinnacle of the mountain, view was breathtaking.

To say the Moon Plains was a once-in-a-lifetime experience would be an understatement. It gave us the true feeling of being in Nuwara Eliya, the gusty winds, the breath taking senary and a chilly experience.

Me and my partner looked forward on seeing the moon plains. With excitement we drove up there, only to find out the place was hijacked by greedy jeep drivers who charge crazy amounts of money (5000 lkr!!) for a 20 minute jeep drive PER PERSON! Excluding entrance fee (600 lkr!! per person). Since its only a 2km walk, we asked to go on foot instead and only pay the entrance fee, only to get chased away by a rude jeep driver who barely spoke english. He was kind of agressive. This country is in dire need of tourism, due to its crisis.Ripping off tourists by asking 10 times the price isnt going to attract them! Some people think they can hiijack a beautiful place as Moon Plain to earn a huge amount of money! Obviously, we went to another place :) If you are a foreigner, avoid this place.
very bad place to visit in sri lanka... not friendly staff.... very bad safari jeep drivers .... they are cheating people...

This is the most efficient safari I have been on. You have to buy a ticket and wait for some time for the vehicles to come. The ticket has the turn number and they follow it to the dot. Beautiful climb to the peak. Unfortunately, we don't get to stay for too long as it's on a rotation and the vehicle has to come down.
A short, bumpy ride to a view point (Which was beautiful) through plantation fields. Overall, beautiful.

when we were on our way, we didn't actually know what the moon plains were. our guide recommended it to us & we agreed. we didn't bother looking it up for some reason. however, it wasn't a disappointment. first, we rode in a car with across the plains & it was sooooooo beautiful!!!!! I love seeing greenery & nature during my travels because we don't have it where I live. there was a variety of trees from bright green to dark green to pink. it was gorgeous. after the drive, we went to the top of a hill ( there was a short stairway so don't worry about climbing) & I cannot describe how beautiful the view was. the atmosphere was cloudy & peaceful. the sun wasn't direct & there weren't any city noises. I could've stayed there forever.
An inspiring place to visit when you're in Nuwara Eliya finding a place to travel. Variety of trees, animals & birds.
Nice place. This is my first travelling experience with moon plains. Such a wonderful place. Recommended for nature lovers.  You can see 9 mountains from one location.

An amazing peak located within the central highlands just off the Nuwara Eliya city limits. The main point of interest of Moon Plains is the view point located at the top of the hill that provides a 360 degree view of the surrounding landscape. They offer safari jeep rides to the top of the hill at a decent fee. Its also said to be the home for many types of birds, deer and Buffalo. A must visit site in the hill country.
Its really worthy traveling to Moon Plains when you visit Nuwara-Eliya. Its better if you can go early morning around 8-9 on a clear sky day.

This is an Agriculture Research Station..which is mainly culturing seed potatoes.which is a serious procedure so they will not allow any out side vehicle to enter inside.reason to avoid fungus,bacteria or any harmful threats for the potato production. Its a bumpy ride to the top..and its worth to see all the 9 mountains out of  famous 10 of sri lanka if you are lucky with the climate. Top is very windy and cold so wear jackets and cover up the kids..
A place to visit with kids. Special  who like to know better about our country. The view  was so beautiful. And lot to learn.

Moon Plains, beautiful location and beautiful background with no animals and all surrounded by a fence to prevent animals from invading farmland. * National Park do not know why? Perhaps because of its immense vegetation. I don't think it's such an interesting place to visit. While traveling with the jeep it is impossible to take photos, since the stretch of road is truly disastrous. Once you reach the top you can enjoy a 360 degree view, but with a limited time duration of 20 minutes. It is not a huge amount of money that we paid 400 rubee per person and then also paid 2000 rubee cash to the driver, but we thought we had something more spectacular from the place. I advise not to spend time visiting Moon Plains because you could enjoy other much more spectacular places.

The place itself (Moon Plains) is nice and picturesque, the only issue is that you have to take a jeep to go there - around 3 km, and are restricted to remain only 20 minutes on the top... We paid 2000 rupees for the jeep ride, which took around 15 minutes up to the plateau, where is a car park. Once you arrive there, there is a walk of 5 more minutes up to the plateau. The driver lets you 20 minutes there, to admire the scenery, take pictures and so on. The view around is really nice, but everything is surrounded by fences, as they say this is for delimiting the jungle from the agricultural terrains and avoiding the entrance of wild animals on the fields. If you could go by foot, that would be much better, but with the jeep I do not see any charm in it. You are also restricted by time, which I hate it, honestly...If I would have known how this is organized, for sure I would have gone in another place. So, if your time in Nuwara Eliya is limited, Moon Plains is not something you should die for to see it.

The place is very close to town. But the only issue is that who ever want to go to that place need to get a safari jeep which will cost you Rs. 6000.00 on top of the entrance fee. Which make useless. Its just 3km distance.  People love to walk and enjoy the view. But with this safari jeep service we wont have the freedom to enjoy the place.

We reached the moon plains office around 7:00am and we were the first to be there on that day. Thay charged 2000/- for the safari ride and 50/- per head. The ride up the hill was great and chilly cz we were only used to ride safari jeeps in hot weather. The views were breathtaking since it was a clear day. You need to get out of the jeep and walk about 50meters to the view point.

we did not see any animal, maybe they took their day off you need a Jeep to go there because the road is horrible then you walk up a few meters and have a 360 degree view. Its nice there and it was very busy one Jeep next to the other. its not a huge amount of money we paid there so it was ok, more spectacular views you have on the "normal" Road from Nuwara Eliya it's better to stop there and see the beautiful landscape

There is nothing to see in this place other than a herd of domesticated buffalo. In fact it's environmental destruction with acres of forest removed for a view that you can get from any of the high country roads. We were forced to take two jeeps for six adults and two small children. Although supposedly run by the government, the staff are pocketing the money. Was issued false tickets.

It located in Nuwara Eliya and just 7km far from nuwara eliya.Also it called mini worlds end. When you go there you can see 9 famous mountains of sri lanka. It was veey beautyful nature. When you go please keep environment clean. You also can get safari jeep experience. If you like to go contact me on 0777 829339 i will take you there. Thanks and best regards.
We reached at 6.00am and we went by safari jeep to see the place. The location was awsome and really enjoyed. We will recomond to go everyone who visiting nuwra eliya.
Great view.  Loved the climate. Must visit in the morning around 7.00 a.m. for a good view on the top of the hill. The view is so relaxing.

The best thing about moon plains is that it's just 15 minutes drive to the ticket office from  the city centre and from there you need to get a safari jeep and another 15to 20 minutes drive to moon plains As of 19th may 2019 local adults are charged rs 50 and for non sri lankans it's rs 400.a safari jeep will cost rs 2000 for both locals and non sri lankans and will take 6 to 8 visitors. Your driver will be your guide as well. The view from moon plains is just amazing. Probably the best in the country. If I have to compare moon plains with hortain plains, I will definitely choose moon plains as it's location is closer  to the nuwara eliya city and got a better view .

column6: Lanka Tours by Lanka Tour Driver
column11: Deine Sri Lanka individuell Rundreisen Mit Privat Fahrer #Nuwaraeliya : is situated in the central province of Srilanka. It's the coldest area in our country. With the hill tops covering the mist it's a heaven to this little country. Flowers in little plants make us blind for a moment giving a feeling of wonder. Water falls out of the mountain tops make our minds relax for a while. Tea plantations runs to the infinity make us so attractive and stick to the area and to the little country. Once it makes us feel the country as a Utopia just with the laughter. Golf ground with green leaves make us playful with horses. Looking at the sun rising by sitting beside the horton plains while smoking or eating peanuts is the best thing I like in my life whenever I get a time to travel with my partner. Looking at the hill is just like a heartiest meditation to forget all the pains in the soul.. it can heal all the bad wounds in your heart.. The picture shows #moonplains in #nuwaraeliya #srilankatourism its my ever loving place around Nuwaraeliya üëåüòç come & travel around Srilanka to see the eyecatching destinations in pearl of the indian ocean like the one mentioned above here .. üë£ üöÜ üèÉ üöå üöó üö∂

We visited Moon Plains on 1 May and fortunately the weather improved as we are nearing the viewing point. Entrance fee is 400 rupees each for foreigners and 50 for locals. After paying the entrance fee, you need to hire a Jeep for 2,000 rupees to get to the viewpoint (driving through the vegetables farm). You can see the surrounding mountains and Nuwara Eliya city from here. It was very windy when we arrived at around 9am+ and cold. So come with some warm clothing.

Moon plain is a recently discovered area in Nuwara Eliya. It is situated in a farming area belong to agriculture department (according to our safari jeep guide). To visit this place first you have to go to farm office where you have to buy tickets. From the same point safari jeeps available for you to take. I can summarize costs as follows (as of April 2019) - Cost per person - Rs 50/- (This is to be paid to farm office and they don't charge for kids) - Cost for the safari jeep - Rs 2000/- One jeep has a capacity of about 6 and if you are with a small group you can join up with another group or family and share the cost as we did. Ride to the plain is about 20 mins and it is a jumpy ride. We have to go through many potato fields. Once you go to the plain you will be astonished by the view as it is totally detached from the urban area. From here you can have a 360 degree view hence you can see almost all the mountain ranges from here. Knuckles range in Badulla district to Piduruthalagala range. Sri Pada range was covered because of another mountain range and mist. We can stay about 30 mins on the plain to enjoy the view. We went in a morning and it wasn't misty too much. I think evening times can be more misty.
The view from the top is definitely worthwhile, but don't expect to see anything else. We did this over Hortons Plains because of lack of time.

We hiked these plains and it was worth every penny we paid. The 360 degrees view of the Sri Lankan mountain ranges is amazing. We paid 5000 rupees for the jeep safari and tickets. We were two adults and two kids. 20 mins to safari and you might like to stay up the summit for a 30 mins. It‚Äôs beautiful. You will love the views from above. Highly recommended for people who cannot do the Hortons plains. This place is also called as Mini world‚Äôs end.

Please get this experience if you are visiting to Nuwara Eliya. I was fed up with the same experience every time I visited to Nuwara Eliya but got to know about this place from one of my friend and it was amazing. Half hour challenging and enjoyable safari drive to the vintage point and its absolutely breathtaking. Safari track was cost Rs. 2,000 for entire family and its worth.

We arrived with our guide and paid 2 x 400LKR for ourselves and 50 for our guide. It was only after cash had been paid that we were told you have to have a jeep for another 2000 per person. Out of principle we asked for our money back, to be told it was not possible as it was government money. As the cash register had displayed 00.00 and the receipt was taken from under the machine and said a time of 08.59 am, it was mid afternoon when we went, We doubt very much the government would be receiving any money! Dishonest people and business

A good place to have a quick visit to moonplains because it‚Äôs very close by to nuwaraeliya city and also you can have a safari travel in the moon plains very good view from some point you can see some wild life and more nature that‚Äôs always needs your clean heart
When you are traveling to nuwara eliya dont forget to go moon plains.perfect view and beautiful nature

I visited with my family during Christmas Season last year and enjoyed it. The jeep ride is fun and the view point provides breathtaking views of different places. Unfortunately some vegetation are under development or being planted during our visit, otherwise it would have more scenic. It takes approx 20 minutes one way and you can spend 30 minutes at te view points.

This plains situated around 3Kms from the Gregory Lake of Nuwara-Eliya.  To reach this view point you have to cross a farm. You cant take your vehicles to the view point. Only authorized hiring safari jeeps can go. So you have to hire a jeep at the entrance point. It was nearly 2000LKR for a jeep which can accommodate around 7-8 travelers. This view point offers a fantastic panoramic view, because you can see popular peaks (Including highest mountain) in Sri Lanka. Best time to visit this place is early morning or evening.

Avoid it if you're visiting Horton Plains. But if you can't hike 9-10 kms at the  Horton Plains, definitely visit the Moon Plains. It's a plateau land that you can reach on jeeps. Offers a beautiful panoramic view of the hills on one side and the plains on the other.
You can visit Moon planes by Safari Jeeps. It is a great 360 degree scenery. You could travel to Hawaeliya to travel to the Agriculture Research Station. The tour guides were quite informative too.

We visit the place with few friends and the location was about 20 minutes from the nuwaraeliya town center. I highly recommend this place if you are searching a place to enjoy the nature with short time distance and time period when you are in nuwaeliya. Its a 360 viewpoint with fabulous views of hills around the area. They are charigind entrance fee 50lkr per each and 2000lkr fee for safari type vehicle, but those are totally fair with the experience you get.
You feel at the top with a range of mountains all around you. Truly a breathtaking view. Enjoyed the ride to the top with friends and family. It is a very scenic place
This one is small treck of about 20-25 mins to hill top which offers a awesome view if the town and lake..
This is kinda Jeep ride to top of the hill where you get a good 360 view of the vally. Cant call it safari has you hardly see any animals ..

Few things I like about this place 1. It does not take long to visit. Can be finished in 2-3 hours 2. If you are visiting with a group, cost can be significantly lower 3. Reasonably decent views considering the time and efforts it takes. 4. You will like this lace if you like to see greenery. So you need to check if it make sense to visit this place just after rainy or in rainy season so that you can see mountains covered with green grass 5. Dont compare with Hortons plains! Both are completely different
This is no safari.  Bison only.  We were taken to the top of the hill. Saw nothing but mist. Came back down. Price about 2000 each.

Our chauffeur guide recommended this place as he felt we were not quite up to visiting Horton Plains (a bit more rigorous than we were capable of). We drove through some very narrow streets from Gregory Lake and arrived at an old army barracks where we transferred to a safari jeep for the 20-30 minute drive to the top of Moon plains. We passed cleared fields and terraced hillsides to finally arrive at a car park. A short walk to the top of the hill opened up to a magnificent view in every direction of mountains surrounding Nuwara Eliya. A large observation platform up a slightly rickety flight of steps improved the view even more. Under the platform were signs attached to the roof showing the name of and height of each mountain we could see. The journey could be improved by including a small tea shop as there is nothing in the vicinity.

Few Miles from Nuwara Eliya, this place is an alternative to people who don't want / don't have time to visit Hortain plains.. They provide Safari Trucks, so you dontt need to worry about waking 7 KMs.. Advice, don't visit on windy days, as you will be clinging to the rails  than enjoying the view
Very short trip with a Jeep - only 3 km drive and the only thing to see is one spot where the Jeep stops and you can watch the view from. Waste of time and money.

Moon Plains ( also known as Sandatanne, Sandagalatanne) is the latest attraction open to public in Nuwara Eliya. This area is now classified as an Agricultural and Environmental Tourism Zone by the Municiple of Nuwara Eliya and was declared opened in 25th March 2014. The plains is located few kilometers off Nuwara Eliya town and is accessed passing the the Government Potato seed Farm at Sita Eliya.

This place is a abandoned potato farm convert to a tourist attraction closer to Nuwara Eliya. Visitors are taken from safari jeeps to view point 2 km into the plains. Not that much of animal life to see. On the view point hut you can see many surrounding mountains and laggala gardens far away. Near the view point you can see the boarder post between uva and central provinces.

This place is worth visiting. Very well protected agro research area. You have to hire a safari jeep from agriculture department's office there to visit Moon Plains. On a day with clear sky you will see 8 out of 9 highest mountains in Sri Lanka from here. Amazing views, fresh air and relaxing atmosphere. Advise avoiding week ends and school holiday season as the place would get busy.
You must have booked your trip early morning if you want to see wild animals in the area. Good enjoyable tour.

This is one of the nice place in Nuwaraeliya. Not so far from Nuwaraeliya town. There are cabs in this place. You cant get your own vehicle until observation place. Cab price is 2000 rupee. 9 people can travel together in one cab.Entrance fee for adult Sri Lankan is 50 rupee. Only if you are nature lover visit this place. If not this will be very boring place to you. Before this place was agricultural land. Sometimes you can see animal species which are specific to Sri Lanka. There is an observation place in moon plains. You can see mountain range in 360¬∞view. And there is a border of central province of Sri Lanka and Uva province. You can capture group photos here with 360 ¬∞ view. It is very awesome. Roming apart from the main road is prohibited. Entering into the cultivation without permission is prohibited. Harming plants and animals and collecting sample is prohibited. Throwing polythene and garbage randomly is prohibited. Carrying alcohol and drugs into the tourist zone is strictly prohibited. Staying after 6.00 p.m within the zone is prohibited. Maximum one hour can spent at the observation place.

This is located very close to the city of Nuwaraeliya. Once you get to the entrance, you will have to take a safari jeep to get to the top of the plain. The specialty here is you have an obscured 360-degree view of 07 of Sri Lanka's main mountains. Definitely worth a visit.

Travelling in jeep was nice. Wide open area with the chances of seeing wild boar, cows, buffaloes, deer. At the viewpoint, you will be able to see the peak point of 9 mountains in Sri Lanka on a clear day.

One of the best place to have a panoramic view of mountains in Sri Lanka. Recently added attraction in Nuwaraeliya with different kind of experience to the travelers. Ideal for a family visit. Early Morning and evening would be the best timings. Good alternative to the travelers especially with kids and elders who hesitate to visit Horton planes due to the distance to walk. Just 3km away from the town so easily reach and you can hire 4WD truck for 2000 LKR for 5-6 Pax. you can park your vehicle safely near the starting place and round trip would take nearly 1 hour.

This is a wonderful place but if you need a unforgettable experience visit the place around 7am. The chargers for a Jeep from locals is around LKR 2000/ and 6 people  can travel. All drivers are well informed about the geographical details , if your getting some  telescopic photoes please get the location details ftom the driver as the area is 360¬∞view you will see many town surrounding this are. Which i missed to do.

Since an animal safari at Minneriya National Park wasn't possible, I chose to explore the safari (non animal safari) at Moon Plains, Nuwara Eliya. This wasn't anywhere close to what it would have been at Minneriya, but the experience was bliss! Entry fee: LKR 400 per pax (tourists) ; LKR 50 (locals) ; LKR 2K (total cost of one jeep: 5-7 pax) Duration: 45 mins - 1 hour I visited Moon Plains in the Month of March, at around 3:00 pm. Mornings are the ideal time to visit. But I was definitely fortunate, to get a great view in the afternoon! Once there, you cannot use your own vehicle to drive up.  There are designated jeep drivers, to drive you around. Along the way, pretty plains/hills and wild buffaloes can be observed. Having lived in the city for years, this was my chance to experience a jeep drive. So the bumpy drive, was definitely not a bother! Once you reach the farthest place, the tour guide takes you to the top most view point (there will be a little trek). From here one can get a magnificent view, of Lanka's 9 mountains. - Advance booking isn't mandatory. - Women shouldn't go here alone. - Clothing that are suited for trekking are ideal. It is advisable to carry a jacket, as it can get cold. - Do not forget to carry a bottle of water. - P. S. Moon Plains is located in a secluded place & there are no eateries around. - P. S. Washrooms aren't clean
What a place on earth, this is a man made plains, but the breathtaking views around this place makes it a must visit place in Sri Lanka. Little known to people, so less crowded.

We been to this place very randomly, it wasnt planned and not even heard about before. while we are planning for horton plains our tour guide suggested this place due to lack of time in our scheduled itinerary. We were amazed with the atosphere on top of the place with adventures bumy jeep ride and rain showers. PS. they provides umbrella too. as weather is really uncertain in nuwara eliya. If you are in the city and have enough time, dont waste it and must go to this place.

The place is off Nuwaraeliya town, need to take an exit after the Gregory Lake. Drive takes around 15 mins to reach following the sign boards, you will reach  a farm where there is a small office that will charge you 2600 LKR for a safari jeep to take you to the actual plains. The open safari jeep will take you through the winding roads while you will be able to take pictures, the driver will stop if you ask him to. As for the wildlife, the whole area is cordoned off by the use of electric fences, this is to protect the crops from hogs. The plain is used for potato farming. If you are lucky you will see some of the wildlife, we were lucky to see a moose running off to the forest through a broken part of the fence and that was it apart from the variety of birds. Once you reach the main view point, you will have a 360 degree view of the mountain range, fantastic view. The guide/driver will be able to tell you which mountain is which. Ensure you reach here early...at least by 7am so that you the mist will not hinder the view.

Good attraction not too far from the Nuwara Eliya city center. Can get there within 5 mins and the Safari to the view point takes about another 15 mins. If you do not have time to go to Horton Plains, this is a great way of site seeing.

When we travelled to Nuwara Eliya, our driver told us about Moon Plains, but could not confirm if it is a worth visit as he had never visited this place. We went there after lunch and were told that the place was closed. So we thought of giving it a try in the morning again, before we go back to Colombo. We went there right after breakfast and found a lot of people waiting for the experience. We decided to wait for an hour max as we had to go back to Colombo. The place was not well organized, ticket counter was crowded and the lady in the counter cannot converse well in English. It is important that staff at any international tourist destination converse in English so that it is easy for the tourists. The place is also not well organized and people keep rushing to board the safari vehicle the moment they see one coming. After waiting for almost an hour and following up with the staff several times, our chance for getting on to the safari truck came. It was a bumpy ride initially, but was totally worth it. The views are amazing. And once you get to the final destination, it is splendid. We were glad we stayed back to visit the Moon Plains.Not to forget, like many other attractions in Srilanka, the discounted pricing for Srilankans is available even here. I would certainly recommend all tourists visiting Nuwara Eliya to visit the Moon Plans.

The views from the top are amazing, however the entry fee is too steep. The same views can be seen from places that can be accessed for free. The staff were nice and the drive through the farm interesting. Make sure if you take a tuk tuk there they know where they are going, there is a few places called moon plains in the area.

We visited Moon Plains on 01st of February 2018. One of the best times to visit the plains was early morning so we arrived at 8am. The authorized jeep ride was  about 20 minutes long and we spotted a Sambar and some endemic Sri Lankan birds on the way. The distance of the ride was about 3km one way. There is a well built view point to experience the 360 degree view of 10 famous mountain ranges in Sri Lanka(Piduruthalagala, Hakgala, Kirigalpoththa,..etc)Moon Plains is also famous as the home to the "Mini Worlds End".

This is an excellent view point in Nuwara Eliya which you could easily reached with a vehicle. You can't access there by your own vehicle instead have to hire a safari jeep from there and it will take you to the moon plains passing beautiful landscapes. The climate change with in minute in this place as when we reach there we couldn't see anything because of the mist and with in two minutes it was sunny and had a great view of mountains. For old visitors it is hard to visit places like Horton plains and so for such travellers Moon Plains is the best option which give you a same kind of feeling just as in Horton Plains. This place is new bee and not older than 3 years so in your next visit to Nuwara Eliya make sure you go and explore this beautiful land side.

Location is about 4Km away from the center of the city. You can drive up to the gate. Then you have to user the jeeps provided by the park to go up to the observation deck. On your way you can see the beautiful landscaping of the nature.
We went on moon plains safari on our day 2 of the 3 days we stayed in Nuwara Eliya. We would recomment to anyone to visit here for scenary.

Very beautiful views from the top of the mountain. Much more convenient that all other places which are far, uncomfortable or more expensive. Just a few kilometers from town you arrive at this place (managed by an Agricultural Center) where you can take a jeep with driver (not expensive), which go up to the hill where you can have a beautiful view of all the surroundings.
You will be charged at the entrance and except that you have to rent out a jeep for 2000Rs . When it come to view ,thats amazing one of the must visit place.

While not in the same scale as Horton Plains, the mini worlds end at Moonplains does offer a great and unique 360 degree view of the surrounding mountain ranges around Nuwara Eliya. The entrance is very close to Nuwara Eliya town, and from the entrance you have to take a safari jeep to the viewing platform. You can't hike on it. It's about 15 to 20 minute drive over hard terrain. If you a travelling alone, the jeeps are a bit expensive, but the jeep can accommodate 7, so if you can get a group, you can share the cost. If its crowded, then you might have to wait a while to get a jeep, since there are a limited number available. If you a travelling with small children, Moonplains is a great alternative to Horton Plains. It's plus points are: - its closer to town - you don't have to hike all the way - doesn't take a long time - offers a unique view
We were freezing all the way in an open jeep, sitting on wet seats, to find out there is absulotely nothing in this place.

It was just okay, the view was wonderful from the top of the lookout point but nothing compared to Horton Plains. The jeep took about 15mins on a bumpy ride to the lookout. The whole visit is limited to two hous at most. Its no value to pay the jeep hire (Rs5000)and entrance fee (Rs400) for such view. You get much more magnificent view for free Mini Adam's Peak of Ella.

It was lovely to see in srilanka we have a such beautiful place..the journey in the Jeep was really excited and my kids enjoyed a lot..the drive who took us was very kind and informative.. overall it was a great experience..

We paid rs400 each for the entrance fee and rs5000 to rent a jeep. The jeep took us on a 15 minute ride to the view point which had a viewing deck. It is a must visit you have extra budget as the view was stunning. It has a similar view as world's end according to our guide but without the hike. It wasn't crowded at all so it was very enjoyable.

We stumbled over Moonplains by accident and decided to explore it. You have to go from the potato farm on special jeeps (its a mud track and cars cant go up) which charge SL 2,000 per trip. It takes around 20 mins to get to the top and you can stay there for an hour. There is a viewing platform which lets you have an incredibale view of the surrounding mountains and vallyes. At times it is misty but the weather in NE is such that the clouds/mist shifts quickly giving you  a glimpse of the faraway mountains. For us the view and magic of the place was worth the cost.

This is situated about 1 km from the main road at the edge of George Lake on the way to Sita Eliya. Ashok is a very good host. The place is located in a calm place. This is only for those who want to stay away from the buzz. If you take a tuk tuk from bus stand you will have to pay 300 LKR. You will not get dinner here. If you inform in advance Ashok will prepare something for you. Not a high flying place. Needs to have more contact with tuk tuk drivers for him to serve his guests. Needs to serve food at night since it is away from town.I

Offering you a similar view to famous Horton Plains, Moons plain is another beautiful attraction in Sri Lanka kept secret. Located in Nuwara Eliya, the main attraction of the place is ‚Äòthe drop‚Äô which known as the ‚Äòsecond world‚Äôs end‚Äô. Misty plains of green grass saturated with a diversity of flora and fauna is an ideal place for anyone who is looking for some pristine nature.

We only got to know about this after arriving in Nuwara Eliya. Sadly we could not visit Horton plains with the small kids and moonplains turned out to be the perfect replacement. Kids enjoyed the jeep ride a lot and at the very end there is an observation desk that you can see 8 out of 9 highest points in Sri Lanka. Must visit for anyone.

This is close by to Nuwaraeliya town. Once you arrive you might think that this could not be the Moon Plains. There is a potato farm belongs to Ministry of agriculture and through this farm only you have to go to Moon Plains. This farm produce the seeds n plants for potato farmers across sri Lanka therefore its a protected area. you need to buy the ticket (entrance ticket) at the counter and pay separately for the jeeps. they wont allow private vehicles to enter to the Moon plains as it goes through the farm. The jeeps are 2000 rupees and minimum 7 to 8 people can travel in it. you can share the jeep as well. these vehicles are not allowed to go out of the farm as well. Simply they do not want any substances which can harm the potato plants to bring in side. leave all your belongings in your vehicle and dont take anything so there is tendency to litter the moon plains. you will travel through the bumpy roads to reach the point and there is  viewing deck as well.  on your way you can see deers (actually the bigger version ) and mountains. its the view which is breathtaking so no activity or anything else to see or do. vehicle will stay for 20 - 30 minutes and take you back to the farm. you have to pay the amount to the driver once you finish the journey.

We visited Moons Plains during our visit to Nuwara Eliya. It's about half an hour drive from Nuwara Eliya city. You have to drop your car at the entry ticket office and book a Jeep as it is a off road drive further. For SAARC adult they charge LKR 400 per head and another LKR 2000 for a private Jeep. One Jeep can accommodate up to 6 people. It's a bumpy ride to the plains so please do take care of kids while in the Jeep. The driver also act as a guide so a small tip at the end of the trip would be good. You can spend almost 30-45 minutes at the main spot. Amazing place to visit for all age groups. Beautiful scenery, dense forest, mountains, cliffs and can spot few animals if you are lucky enough. It's a must visit site if in Nuwara Eliya. Take as many pictures, I am sure you will find one of the best wallpaper pic at this spot.

Moon Plains is a good experience in Nuwara Eliya since there is not many activities that you could do there so it was exciting for us to go on a safari on,the mountains. We reached there  in the morning around 10 am but couldn't see any deer or rabbits since they go into hiding for the noise that the safari jeeps make. Yet, there were wild buffaloes. We also saw acres of potato plantation. The guide who drove the Jeep was very friendly and showed us the different cities that can be seen from up above. Within 20 minutes we were driven down again. It costs lkr 2000 to rent the Jeep and lkr 50 per person.

Its a safari jeep trip to the moon planes. Its the only place which can see the entire mountain range in one place. some times you can see some animals some times you may not. but its nice great place to visit.  you can see the potato seed farms on your way and a cool climate at the edge.

If you want to feel shocked and awed at the same time,this should be the perfect place for that. The only place with a 360 degree view of 9 mountains and rightfully deserves its name, 'Mini World's End". A safari jeep needs to be hired at the entrance to take the 2 hour long journey. Slightly expensive for Rs.2000, but the guides were quite competent and friendly. Make it a must on the agenda on your next visit to Nuwara Eliya. If you are lucky enough you can also see several wild animals as well. Recommended to travel early in the morning. Really wish to see how the view would look like on a full moon's night!!
The jeep safari was fun, the great scenery, the fresh air, my only disapointment was the heavy fog on the top of the plains ...we couldn't take photos nor see the surrondings...

This is a beautiful location and worth visiting. They charge and entrance fee and then they charge you separately for the safari jeep. The price printed on the board was 2000 srilankan. But the driver insisted we pay 4000 srilankan which was double the listed price. We paid because we had come up all the distance. Left a bad feeling of being taken for a ride.

Moon plains is situated About 3 kms from Nuwara Eliya.. you have to hire a safari jeep to get you to the plains .. we drove through potato fields ... a bumpy ride but the kids Enjoyed the experience .. entrance was rs 50/- .. breath taking view from the top .. It's a 360 degree view of 9 mountains on a clear day .. it's always better to get there early before the mist rolls in .. well worth a trip if you are holidaying in nuwara eliya..

Very attractive place to visit. We must used to jeep service provided by the farm and need to pay the jeep+tickets. Jeep can accommodate 6 peoples. All travel time is around 2-3 hours. Morning visit are recommended.

Anyone can go, good stoning views. Beautiful picture, good place for a snack as well as group photos. Pleasant climate while sunny. However jeep drivers needs better understanding of tourism, ei, the do not find interesting places although go up to the mountain as there would be any possible target.

The tour takes around 2 hours and if its a clear sunny day the view from the top is fantastic. Still you cannot compare with Horton Plains which is far better in respect of view and horticulture you get there. You cannot go in your own vehicles but have to hire a jeep from the office below.

The 360 view of the Central Province and the Uva Province you find from the top of the moon plains at the view point is just breathtaking. Seven mountains inluding the three tallest mountains can be seen from Moon Plains. If you visit there in the morning, probably you might see some wild animals. Even though it is the afternoon, two or three wild animals will surely be caught to your sight! :) Once you reach the Moon Plains office, you are supposed to reserve a safari jeep to ascend moon plains.. No wonder this is called a min worlds' end! :)
A breath taking view. Just a few minutes away from NuwaraEliya town. It is not possible to imagine that there is such a place in NuwaraEliya. Very nice place....

Location is close to city. Lovely scenery which was 360 went you reach the top it becomes cold and windy. You have to stop your vehicle there ans take their safari jeeps. There were vegetable cultivation to seen at first when moving further wild animals were to been seen when we were traveling. At times mist was covering up.
It's a rough jeep ride through the park so be prepared to be jolted. Up hill trek to the viewing point so be prepared for walking on uneven road. But the views are stunning so worth a visit
The mini safari and view point is best location to have scenic view of all mountains and peaks.The signage to place is not clear and we have to ask many people for directions.

Moonplain is a windy summit that will blow your mind. You can see nice spectacular view of large number of mountains from one place. Please make sure that you tie your belonging as wind can be so powerful at some times.

This is must see place in Nuwara Eliya. Last time (November 2015)we went in a morning and couldn't see anything due to thick mist. This time we drive straight to Moon Plains and got in to a jeep in the noon. View from this place is amazing. You can see 8 mountain ranges (Piduruthalagala, Namunukula, Hakgala, Thotupola, Kirigalpoththa, great western, single tree and kikiliyamanna) in your 360 degree view. What i heard from the Jeep driver is that morning is the best time to go to this place as you may see wild animals also. But I recommend noon as less chances of mist that can hide your view totally.

Moon Plains is a new attraction in Nuwara Eliya managed by by a govt. department. The ride in the jeep passing the seed potato farm is rather bumpy in a jeep, but an interesting experience over rough terrain. Once you reach the viewpoint, you get a beautiful 360 degree view of the surrounding peaks and towns. It is like a mini World's End but the view is wider if the weather is good.  The plains is said to be home to elk, wild buffaloes, deer and a variety of birds, but we saw only jungle fowls and wild buffaloes in the distance. It can be very windy on top. One problem is that this is not a guided tour, and everything is left to private jeep drivers. The lack of toilet facilities at either end is a problem. The Dept. of Agriculture should be more receptive to needs of tourists, both local and foreign (who are charged much more). A good brochure explaining the attraction and safety concerns should be provided.

Beautiful sceneries. But the ride upto the viewing point is so bumpy, elderly people or those with back pains would find it difficult. Rs.2000 for the safari jeep. Driver did not explain anything about the surrounding. Very close to Nuwara eliya Gregory lake.Sign Boards are put up.

Small drive off Nuwara Eliya, the entrance is situated in Badulla road closer to Gregory lake. Guiding boards are placed, so it is not hard to find the way. Situated inside the Potate farm, tourists will have to buy a ticket of Rs. 50 (for locals) per head and Rs. 2000 (for locals) for the jeep. They do not allow any other vehicles than those jeeps. Better to avoid doing so, since the road condition is really bad. Considering the travel time and the distance personally feels Rs. 2000 is too much. It is a great panoramic view one can get when reached to the place. Observation deck is also there. Refer my photos for the view

This is not a safari. It is a drive up a hill on a track through farm land to a viewing platform. Yes good view but can see this in other places for free; here it will set you back 5000 rupee for the jeep plus entry 400 rupee per person.

Located 30 min drive away from the city of nuwaraeliya this place is a easy accessible even for a elderly person. Actually this land is own by Sri Lankan government and used to produce potato seeds. You can easily drive your own car to the farm and from there you have take the safari jeeps. After driving across the farm with beautiful mesmerizing views you can reach the view point. Take your wind angles and perfect for time lapse videos. They open at 7 a.m. Go  early as possible you'll be lucky.

Moons plains is most suitable and outstanding environmental view in  Nuwara eliya. It's not far away from the city.  In hear we can see 7 highest mountain in Sri Lanka and this is the only one place can see like this. And also can see 360‚Ä¢ view from hear different districts and many cities in Sri Lanka.
Location is not so far from the city. 4km drive by a safari jeep from the ticket counter to destination. the view will disappear suddenly by mist.
Went with Family... Foggy in the evenings... you can see five provinces in Sri Lanka.... View should be fantastic when no mist. Haven't seen any animals. Kids enjoyed the Jeep rids

Moon plains is beautiful and can be visited as a substitute to "World's end which takes longer time"  if only you can avoid the ticketing staff and jeep drivers which is practically impossible. They will charge you more if you are a foreigner and if you point out the unfair pricing they will argue, scream and disrespect you. While the entry fee was clearly mentioned separately for foreigners (which we had no problem paying), they demanded extra for jeep (which wasn't mentioned anywhere). They refused to take us unless we paid more and even threatened us that we were in Sri lanka ( Don't know what they were implying)  when we demanded an explanation for charging us more. Also, there were no restrooms for ladies and god knows how we managed 4 hours without it. No wildlife around and bumply road up the hill. The country is beautiful but we wouldn't want to go back due to the these unpleasent encounters.

it is said that it is somewhat like horton plain. but when my driver came along with us he said horton plain is quite interesting. Since this is new site. Govt needs to invest lot of money and develop it. infrastructure is less.

Just a great trip, cost 7000lkr for a family of four for the jeep safari. Long bumpy ride across the "plains" was absolutely amazing with the clouds passing by and the cold winds, at the top 9 different famous peaks of Sri Lanka were visible. There isn't any fixed price, bargain as much as you can. Go on a clear rain free day as the view wasn't complete with the rain clouds. The guide was a nice guy and explained many things on the way.

This site was not included in our plan but our tour operator recommended it, because it is not far from Nuwara Eliya and it was really worth, despite it costed almost 50 dollars per 2 person. To reach the tot spot, the jeep drove us through the government potato seed farm, it is very beautiful way, where we had a long stop (upon our request) because up there, built on high terrace and you can watch the surroundings which consist of green meadows and 8-9 high mountains.In one word- amazing.

this is one safari that can be avoided. overpriced at SKR 5000 for 2, the open jeep drives up the mountain to an unremarkable viewing tower. The drive is through potato farms and the bumpy road is about the only exciting part of the journey. there are abso no animals to be seen, just miles of human encroachment on forest land through farming. The only redeeming factor was the sight of the majestic mountains from the view point and the complex cacaphony of jungle sounds that were audible in that area. I am thankful for getting to the edge of the jungle at least.

This should be the first plan when someone traveling in nuwaraeliya. You can see main mountains in Sri Lanka in a clear day. Make sure to visit at 7am and get a safari jeeps. I heard they have 14 jeeps in their pool. You an see 360' view in summit and there is a mini worlds end.

We decided to visit Moon Plains after reading a review in a Sri Lankan Sunday supplement about this new attraction and it suited us as we have a 4 year old and it's very close to Nuwara Eliya.  From the article, we expected a natural wilderness, wildlife, including many bird species and culminating in a wonderful viewpoint.  Well, a natural wilderness, this certainly ain't.  The drive to the view point is through 3km of potato seed fields, farmed in an intensely chemical way, so much so that the stench from the pesticides they were spraying was often overwhelming.  This intense farming runs right the way up to the view point, a little viewing tower on top of a small hill.  The view from the viewpoint is absolutely outstanding however.  I counted 8 layers of hills and mountains through the morning mists.  Probably the best view I've seen in Sri Lanka but they need to find a much more attractive way of getting you to it
Fantastic views of the sri lankan mountains. Rented a jeep for 8000 plus tickets for 1000. Worth every penny

Opens at Sri-lankan 6.30 am!! and you will be taken by jeep to the view point where there are quite stunning views across to Ella and back to Nuwara Eliya and Hakgalla.  It is definitely worth getting up for a dawn trip.  This is relatively unknown but it is a realistic alternative to Worlds End at Horton Plains and very similar.  Thanks to our Driver Shammi who knew about this and arranged it.

It takes just 10 mins drive from the Nuwara Eliya town...Once you reach the starting point you have to pay upfront for the jeep (2000 Rs per jeep which can easily transport 6 people) and a very nominal entry fee (atleast for locals) 50rs per adult and 25rs per child....a 20 min jeep ride through beautiful potatoes estates take you to the top of viewing area and the view is breathtaking....Definitely worth a visit

I have been to world's end two times and I just wanted to try the new concept of moon plains. It's totally different from world end and we can see much animals than world and and seven mountains of srilanka as well. It's good for save time and not to be tiered of walking to worlds end.

New Attraction. The main attraction is the view of several mountain peaks (on a clear day - we were very fortunate despite the weather forecast to have brilliant weather). And if you are early enough (6.30 a.m), you can catch sight of some animal life (Sambur, Peacocks,Kites..if the sound of the truck does not scare them away!). You have to take the available privately run safari truck a bit overpriced for a 45mn drive. Personal vehicles not allowed due to pollution - not sure how the diesel safari trucks qualify over a hybrid non pollutant SUV. But one of the few things to do in Nuwara Eliya.Only access to location by private vehicle.

Moon plains is a newly established Mini World's end in Nuwaraeliya. It is situated at Potato seed farm-Seethaeliya. It is essentially need to have a private vehicle to reach there from Nuwaraeliya town as public transportation is not operated there.Though you go by your vehicle, to enter the Moon Plains you have to hire a safari jeep. It costs Rs 2000 for locals. After about 45 minutes travel you will reach the observation point. During the jeep transportation you are not allowed to get down. From this observation point you can view nine highest peaks of Sri Lanka except Adam's peak. But it happens in a clear day. In a misty day it is just a visit only. This is not an alternative for Hortain Plains.
good place to visit but not much  greenish view  nothing to say i we colud  see some animals deers more

This is the newest attraction in N'Eliya after Horton plains.Take the road near gregory lake & follow the sign boards.Some wild life is present (Sambar,Monkey,Eagles...).You can see 6 out of seven major mountains from the peak.A Must do!
Great nature tour and nice view. Price was little high. They charged $25 per person. But we enjoyed lot on first day of the year.

Probably this is a newly setup attraction. This is actually a potato plantation. Now they have set up a sight seeing excavation as side business it seems. You drive up to their office, park your vehicle, pay for the Jeep. Jeeps are all new (indian jeeps). We had about 10 traveling in our Jeep and the cost was shockingly low (not sure if it is so for the tourists however we did not see any tourists). The jorney to the plains is about 6 kms... its a gravel road and there are a few patches where it is bit scary. Views are beautiful. Eventually you end up at a viewing point, where you can climb up and see entire sri lanka (just kidding).

Moon Plains was suggested by our Travel Agent/ Driver and we really looked forward to visiting this place set in the beautiful Nuwara Eliya. The ticket cost is indicated as SLR 400 per head ( for Foreigners and Indians) which is way too high than the cost for locals which is SLR 50 per head.  Apart from that, there was a Jeep Fee of SLR 2000 which was listed with no clarification or details. Not knowing the local language and lack of internet access can be a major problem as we got ripped off totally indicating that the jeep fee is SLR 2000 per head which is ridiculous. Unfortunately there was no body around to help and just because we traveled all the way there and wanted to see the place we ended up paying SLR 7200 for 3 people , where as it should have been only SLR 3200.  And also we didnt get to see any animals apart from the occasional monkeys. Definitely good place but not worth it.

The tickets for admission was 400lkr then seeing we were not locals the jeep guy asked for 4200 lkr which was just quoted as they charge locals only 2000lkr finally we paid 2800lkr .we went at noon so did not see any animals according to the driver you see them post 4 pm

We were lucky the weather was sunny and clear. You could see the famous 7 mountains (don't remember the names:)). It is not very expensive. I wish there was a coffee place at the top to have a drink and enjoy the view

This is few miles away from Gregory lake. There will be a farm in the and you have to ask for a jeep ride,  which cost around 3500 slr per 6 to 8 people. One you get in to the destination there is a view point, where you can observe whole Uva province in one go.

Be there by 9AM before the clouds start rolling in. Place opens up at 7AM. Come there earlier and you will notice wild life. Superb 360 degree view. You are able to see the Highest Peak (Pidurutalagala), 2nd Highest peak (Kirigalpoththa), third highest peak (Thotupola Kanda), 6th Highest peak (Great Western Mountain), 7th highest peak (Hakgala). Need to park the vehicle at entrance and go in a safari jeep... can get quite cold during the ride and it can get windy at the look out point ( jeep ride for locals 2000/= for six persons) The look out point, indicates the directions at which the above mentioned mountains are visible

The best time to travel is before 10.00 Am. We can reach entrance of Moon plains with our own vehicle or hired but no public transportation. Walking is prohibited through Moon plains except the given area. Private vehicles are not allowed to enter here and we need to take Safari jeep from the entrance(cost about 2000 LKR). If we reach to the peak in the morning (before the mist) we can see 360 view of surroundings.

This place is just amazing with cold breeze and stunning views all around. If someone visit Nuwara Eliya, please do go see the beauty of this place. In my point of view, moon plains is better than horton plains. If you are lucky enough you will also see wild life there including leopards. But on the day of my visit, we couldn't see any. It was just amazing though. The driver who came with us was very friendly and he mentioned that the road is slippery if its raining but people even visit on rainy days. You also can experience a good off road tour ;) On the top most place it was so windy and freezing cold but we could see 360 view for sometime and suddenly it was vanished from the mist. Great experience!!!

This is said to be the highest elevation in Nuwara Eliya. This place has 360 degree view covering 6 mountain ranges of Sri Lanka. This place is accessed passing the the Government Potato seed Farm at Sita Eliya. This place is open for Public since early 2014. However when travel here you will see these mountain ranges or can experience thick mist. We experience latter (fortunately or unfortunately). To visit this place drive in to Government Potato seed Farm and at the car park take a vehicle (these vehicles are like what is available in many wildlife sanctuaries -rate is Rs. 2000 + entrance ticket fee ) and drive uphill on a bumpy road. This place open at 7:00 am but if you like to see scenic view better try to select clear time with no rain/mist. As what I heard from the driver / guide, February- April would be a better time.
